memberList.bio: Austin Smith is an inspiring Computer Science and Japanese major that decided to start the UNCC Student Coalition to create a way for students to come together as a community and empowered their voices. “I just wanted to create a place where students can collectively organize and support their communities through various social movements such as racial, social, and climate justice. With the recent Covid-19 crisis it’s become apparent that students lack a proper voice as it pertains to the decision that UNCC makes, and I believe that we as students should have some input in what our school decides to do. Hopefully, the student coalition can empower students to have a greater voice in all aspects of their lives.”

He is a member of the UNC Executive Branch Service Committee and previously worked as a campus representative for Pink. Last year, Jocelyn worked as an intern for the Orange County Democratic Party through their County-to-County program and as an Environmental Law Research Intern with Professor Don Hornstein.

She is majoring in History with a minor in Conflict Management. Diane previously served as our Outreach and Programming Director. Last year, she participated in the Organizing Corps in Raleigh. Diane currently works as a Paul and Sheila Wellstone Organizing Fellow through the Orange County Democratic Party and is a member of Kappa Delta Sorority.
